item.title: Report E-2025010195
item.description:
Report E-2025010195

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-23T21:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-14
  • City: FONTANA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 14, 2025, two (2) 2-gallon pails of UN2922 were damaged in a load shift and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the pallet. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew overpacked the damaged jugs in one (1) 55-gallon drum. All impacted PPE was containerized in one (1) 15-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2025010218
item.description:
Report E-2025010218

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-23T21:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-24
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0645 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal UBY. It was reported that approximately (1) 5 Gallon metal pail of # 12198 SG CLR Ecothane PT-A released due to forklift puncture by the driver from UIV. The release impacted a total of 3) 5-gallon pails and Dock 89. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. The terminal used a 25-gallon metal drum for the waste.
